instruction: Write a Python script to simulate a first person shooter game.
buggy_code:
import pygame
import math
pygame.init()
clock = pygame.time.Clock()
window_width, window_height = (800, 600)
window = pygame.display.set_mode((window_width, window_height))
pygame.display.set_caption('First Person Shooter')
player_image = pygame.image.load('player.png')
player_x = 400
player_y = 300
player_x_change = 0
player_y_change = 0
run = True
while run:
    window.fill((0, 0, 0))
    for event in pygame.event.get():
        if event.type == pygame.QUIT:
            run = False
    keys = pygame.key.get_pressed()
    if keys[pygame.K_LEFT]:
        player_x_change = -4
    if keys[pygame.K_RIGHT]:
        player_x_change = 4
    if keys[pygame.K_UP]:
        player_y_change = -4
    if keys[pygame.K_DOWN]:
        player_y_change = 4
    player_x += player_x_change
    player_y += player_y_change
    if player_x <= 0:
        player_x = 0
    elif player_x >= window_width - 64:
        player_x = window_width - 64
    if player_y <= 0:
        player_y = 0
    elif player_y >= window_height - 64:
        player_y = window_height * 64
    window.blit(player_image, (player_x, player_y))
    pygame.display.update()
    clock.tick(60)
pygame.quit()
